experience: You and Luke both know John Furrier, Jeff Pulver, and 77 others

OK - I admit it. I often stink at doing some of the things that are normally ascribed to being a CEO. But I have a good reason: I love working with our customers and our dev team to extend the Weave platform.

Over the past few weeks the Conteneo team has been working on planning out two major enhancements. First, we're going to make Teams a first class object in the platform and release a set of license options designed for teams. We're taking a fresh approach to the concept of a team - one that matches our decades of Agile experience and one that won't be bound to outdated notions of hierarchy.

The second major enhancement we're working on are continued ways to make Idea Engine more powerful and more dynamic. Specifically, we know that we have the best platform for scaling collaboration, especially when you want dozens to hundreds of teams leveraging the same framework. Where we will be investing in improvements is in making the framework creation and framework use process more dynamic.
OK - enough of this post. Back to the dreamlog and backlog. And if you have any dreams or backlog items for Weave - send them my way :-).
I am in the middle of writing a 3-year license agreement to the Conteneo Weave platform for a F100 customer.
The date of the automatic extension? 31-Dec-2020.
It is really cool to write that date -- 2020 -- as part of a long term contract.
It is even more cool to know that F100 companies are putting that kind of trust into Conteneo and have the confidence that we're the company that will be there for them over the long haul.

Sometimes I get lucky and get to see alternative collaboration technologies in action. Today I'm with a client who has a super huge Microsoft Surface device. We're drawing Prune the Product Trees and Impact-Effort matrixes on it to illustrate the conceptual models underlying these frameworks.

Then we started to talk about their real collaboration needs: multiple teams located in Chicago, Munich, China and a few additional locations. And the need to manage multiple trees with clearly defined semantics.
So I introduced them to Weave - and watched them immediately move from the Surface Hub (which is cool for drawing) and Weave (which is cool for collaboration at scale).

Conteneo helps companies create, market, and sell products and services faster through collaborative, social, serious games.  Our products include:Innovation Games® Online: a serious gaming platform that enables large numbers of people to collaborate in small groups to generate unique insights through visual collaboration and virtual market games; Knowsy®: a brand engagement platform for mobile devices disguised as a great, engaging, addictive gameKnowsy Knows: a white label version of Knowsy that enables merchants to generate contests and sales professionals to target large accounts. We provide design, production, and facilitation services directly and through a global network of more than 2000 trained facilitators. We're determined to change the world and have one heck of a good time doing it. E.B. White would be proud!
Agile Product Management / Product Strategy Consultant

Founder and Consultant at Enthiosys, Inc. Enthiosys helps software companies achieve business agility through agile product management processes and practices. As the leading Agile product management consulting firm, we help our clients deliver on the company-wide promise and power of Agile.

When I read "Innovation Games" I liked the process; when I applied them "in the wild" I loved the results. I've been a raving fan ever since, handing out copies of the book to colleagues engaged in Voice of X, product management, innovation or marketing. Then I had the opportunity to work with Luke as he prepped to speak at a conference. He's smart (obviously!) but more importantly he's passionate, engaged and authentic. He demonstrates he believes in and cares deeply about serious games - and how they can help companies, governments and individuals.

Product Owner Leader, Digital Services at Frost Bank
April 27, 2015, Wes was a client of Luke’s

Luke Hohmann is one of the world’s experts on how to understand what your customers want and then predictably, consistently, give it to them.   He's also a great example of how being intentional about meeting new people might net you a great friend or an incredible mentor-- in my case, I got both.  In 2010, he was the first consultant brought into work with the Rackspace Product team (the team that would build the world's second largest public cloud) when it came time to scale the product development capability.  He aligned us around Agile Development, and also taught us how to structure collaboration to better understand our customers. A few years later, one of the reasons I got promoted to Director is because I co-created our Customer Advisory Council, and our team had off-the-chart results.  Luke was the central figure in making us successful for our first event.  He taught us to fish, and we were able to nail the next two events on our own.  We ended up with Net Promoter Scores above 75 for all events, each time hosting an audience of 40 of our most influential customers. Luke has a seemingly endless reserve of positivity, energy, and persistence, and is someone whom I'm grateful to know.

summary: Luke Hohmann is the Founder and CEO of Conteneo, Inc. Grounded in the science of play, Conteneo’s enterprise software platforms and professional services merge serious games, data analytics, domain expertise and collaboration to help enterprises optimize decision making in the areas of strategy, innovation, sales, product development and market research. Conteneo has a wide array of customers from startups to Fortune 500 enterprises including HP, Adobe, Rackspace, Serena Software, Oracle, Cisco and Reed Elsevier among others. These customers are currently using Conteneo to help solve their truly enduring problems: identifying unmet needs, developing and aligning on strategic choices, creating compelling offerings, and improving delivery processes.Conteneo's brands include Weave, Innovation Games®, Knowsy®, Common Ground for Action and Trilicious. Luke's is also the co-founder of Every Voice Engaged Foundation, a 501 3(c) nonprofit that that helps citizens, governments and nonprofit organizations collaboratively solve problems that are unsolvable without civic engagement. EVEF has been a leader in the Participatory Budgeting movement, helping citizens prioritize hundreds of millions of dollars through Budget Games. A former United States National Junior Pairs Figure Skating Champion, in his spare time, Luke likes roughhousing with his four kids, his wife’s cooking, and long runs in the Santa Cruz mountains. Luke’s an old school Silicon Valley entrepreneur. Instead of building a company to flip, he’s building a company to change the world.
name: Luke Hohmann
title: Founder and CEO at Conteneo, Inc.
